III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was provided to the new Chief Administrator about the
steps to gain access to the CWLM operating system.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided to the facility if they are to change to a new restraint
model that a CWL 4625, Restraint Model Request for Child Caring Intuitions
needs to be submitted to their licensing consultant prior to the implementation

of the model into their program. Along with the submitted CWLM 4625 form,
the facility needs to submit an updated behavior management policy and
information on the requested restraint model. The facility is to not use the new
restraint model until approval is given by the DCWL Director via an approval
letter.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001298 with a CAP approval date of 05/13/2024
was a result of a violation for staff not following the facility’s supervision policy. The
staff member involved within this incident is receiving consultation by leadership
about the supervision concern. The unit will be reviewing the supervision policy at
their unit meeting. The facility will be updating the “back to basics” document to
align with their current policies and work instructions. The facility is currently
complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP
compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001230 was completed on 04/24/2024 that
required a CAP. This investigation resulted in two violations under the Behavior
Management rules. It was found that a staff pushed a youth, and another staff
used derogatory language and name calling of a youth. The corrective action plan
is pending approval.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator reports
there has been no barriers associated with corrective action measures put into
place to address the staff and documentation issues resulting in non-compliance.
Over this past year they have implemented putting in "tap out" training during
monthly staff meetings focusing on staff members reaching their emotional limits.
The facility plans to continue to meet monthly to review past and current corrective
action plants to maintain compliance.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The staff reported feeling supported by direct supervisors as well as
administration. The staff reported feeling the trainings they have received have
been beneficial. When asked if there was anything they would want to change at
the facility, staff reported youth centered services such as occupational therapy
with the youth or more physical activities.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth all reported feeling safe at the facility and feel that their
voice is heard. The youth reported that they enjoy the food at the facility and when
they get to go on outings with staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 25, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
